column4: Is there a program I could use to reformat this NTFS partition without losing ANY of the data contained within? All I wish to do is shrink the partition.
reformatting *equals* deleting all data
: Well then, can I SHRINK the partition?
Yep. First, run a disk check; degrag; run a disk check. Then you can use 'parted' to resize
: Problem.
: I'm RUNNING windows on a 150 gig partition. I need to run Windows on a 110 gig partition.

Yes. Just checka dn defrag it (from within windows) and then resize from the Ubuntu CD.
There is no implied or other warranry on that resize operation.
